decks.notes: This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle using low-cost creatures like Kor Skyfisher, Militia Bugler, and Squadron Hawk. It also incorporates various spells like Prismatic Strands and Battle Screech to protect and boost your creatures. The goal is to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Journey to Nowhere. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Greatsword of Tyr and Ramosian Rally to further enhance your creatures' combat abilities and close out the game efficiently.

The main idea of this UR Control deck is to disrupt opponent's strategy and control the game by countering spells, removing threats, and drawing cards. It utilizes efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Skred, along with card draw engines like Augur of Bolas and Ponder. The deck also includes protection spells like Spell Pierce and Counterspell to maintain board control. By utilizing a mix of creatures, burn spells, and counter magic, the deck aims to outvalue its opponent and win the game through attrition and incremental advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of Elves and use mana acceleration from cards like Arbor Elf and Priest of Titania to play multiple threats quickly. Cards like Timberwatch Elf and Lead the Stampede provide powerful buffs and card advantage, while Quirion Ranger and Birchlore Rangers offer additional flexibility and mana fixing. With a focus on generating a wide board presence and leveraging the synergy between Elf creatures, this deck aims to outpace and overrun the opponent in a fast-paced aggressive manner.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing various removal spells and creatures. The deck contains cards that provide card advantage, such as Ichor Wellspring and Lembas, while also including disruptive elements like Avenging Hunter and Troublemaker Ouphe. The presence of Thorn of the Black Rose and Troll of Khazad-dûm helps maintain card advantage and board presence. The deck also features utility lands like Bojuka Bog and Khalni Garden to support its game plan. Overall, the Golgari Garden control deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through its efficient removal and threat management.

This deck focuses on control through the use of removal spells and creatures that can generate card advantage. The key strategy revolves around utilizing Pestilence as a board wipe while maintaining card advantage through effects like Ichor Wellspring and Lembas. Guardian of the Guildpact and Thorn of the Black Rose provide resilient threats, while Kor Skyfisher can bounce creatures for value. The deck also includes lifegain options like Campfire and Radiant Fountain to stabilize against aggressive decks. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents through attrition and card advantage.
